info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 26 at 10:57PM EDT until July 27 at 1:45AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM EDT THURSDAY FOR SOUTHERN CLARION COUNTY... At 1057 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain were exiting the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly dur to the runoff from the recent heavy rain. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Rimersburg, Sligo, Limestone and Callensburg. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
